arm_group.description: At this group the patients will receive dental implants which have a modified SLA surface. These surface have wettability, which could improve and accelerate the osseointegration.
The patient of this group will receive implant with conventional surface, SLA (Sandblasted and Acid-Etched Surface).

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to compare the stability of dental implant surface treated by
      sandblasting abrasive particles and acid subtraction (Control) with hydrophilic surfaces
      dental implants (chemical) and with a higher surface energy (Test) for a period of 16 weeks
      after installation. The evaluation will be made by analyzing the resonance frequency
      (Ostell). The hypothesis to be tested will be that implants with hydrophilic surface show
      increased secondary stability prior to the implants treated by acid etching.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Stability of Implants With Two Different Surface Treatments

detailed_description.textblock:
The selected patients will be randomly divided into two groups by computer-generated list.
      The control group will receive implant surface treated by acid etching and test group
      receive implants with hydrophilic surface (Test). Both the test and the control group will
      undergo the same pre-surgical, surgical and post-surgical protocols.

      The evaluation of the implant will be done by the analysis of resonant frequency wich will
      be performed on each implant with Osstell (Integration Diagnostics AB, Goteborg, Sweden)
      immediately after implant placement (baseline) and at follow-up sessions (1st, 2nd, 3rd,
      5th, 8th, 12th and 16th weeks after installation) and coefficient of implant stability (ISQ)
      on these dates will be measured on a scale from 0 to 100. The smartpeg be used with special
      developed Healing without the use of pillars or intermediaries.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who had lost teeth in the posterior maxilla (region of premolars and molars,
             can be interspace or free end) in need of restoration with implant-supported
             prostheses

          -  Able to understand and sign a waiver of informed free consent

          -  Good oral hygiene

          -  The receiving implant sites must have at least 3 months of healing after tooth
             extraction, proper height and width to install an implant of 4.3 mm in diameter and
             10 mm of high.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients requiring implants in the mandible or anterior maxilla  (bone type I and
             II), or to submit any of the following conditions: general contraindications for
             surgical procedures, uncontrolled diabetes, severe bruxism or clenching, pregnant and
             lactating women, active periodontal disease, smoking and use of alcohol or drugs

          -  Patients who underwent radiotherapy near the buccal cavity regions chemotherapy and
             those who use or have recently used bisphosphonates, such as alendronate.

intervention.description: Dental implant surgery with two different kinds of implant surface (SLA and modified SLA)

facility.name: Dentistry School - University of São Paulo

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Stability of Implants With Two Different Surface Treatments: a Randomized Clinical Trial

primary_outcome.description: If the implant has been not integrated to the bone!

reference.citation: Bornstein MM, Wittneben JG, Brägger U, Buser D. Early loading at 21 days of non-submerged titanium implants with a chemically modified sandblasted and acid-etched surface: 3-year results of a prospective study in the posterior mandible. J Periodontol. 2010 Jun;81(6):809-18. doi: 10.1902/jop.2010.090727.

Schwarz F, Wieland M, Schwartz Z, Zhao G, Rupp F, Geis-Gerstorfer J, Schedle A, Broggini N, Bornstein MM, Buser D, Ferguson SJ, Becker J, Boyan BD, Cochran DL. Potential of chemically modified hydrophilic surface characteristics to support tissue integration of titanium dental implants. J Biomed Mater Res B Appl Biomater. 2009 Feb;88(2):544-57. doi: 10.1002/jbm.b.31233. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

results_reference.citation: Degidi M, Piattelli A, Shibli JA, Perrotti V, Iezzi G. Bone formation around one-stage implants with a modified sandblasted and acid-etched surface: human histologic results at 4 weeks. Int J Periodontics Restorative Dent. 2009 Dec;29(6):607-13.

secondary_outcome.description: If the implant get successively and it has been integrated to bone. The stability will be evaluated at the surgery day (T0), one week after surgery (T1),after 2 weeks (T2), after 3 weeks (T3), after 5 weeks (T4), after 8 weeks (T5), after 12 weeks (T6) and after 16 weeks (T7).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
